pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.11: According to Sp 2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.12: For phalāphale see PED, sv. ā⁴.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.13: According to Vin-vn-ṭ 1907 uttaribhaṅga is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean curries, which are called sūpa.
